title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 160.7 - Business licenses issued to residential practitioners
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 160.7 - Business licenses issued to residential practitioners

State Regulations
(a) A residential business must be confined
to a room or rooms separate and apart from any residential or other, non-business uses, thereby segregating the hazards of the workplace to such
confined areas. (b) The residential
business must be equipped with the facilities and instruments required by this

Part. (c) The business area of the
residence shall be subject to inspection by representatives of the department
at any reasonable time. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
160.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
